description: This file implements the core functions for a Buffer Object within the SLAP (Service Logic Aggregation Plane) framework. It includes creation, removal, object enrollment, and initialization routines for the SlapScoBuffer object, with functions to reset and access buffer data and size.

classes.name: SLAP_SCO_BUFFER_OBJECT
classes.description: The primary object representing a buffer in the SLAP architecture, containing function pointers for operations like reset, get size, and get data.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE SlapScoBufCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs and initializes a new SLAP SCO Buffer object, allocating memory and setting up function pointers.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapScoBufRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the buffer object, freeing associated resources.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapScoBufEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enrolls required subordinate objects for the buffer, preparing it for use.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapScoBufInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes the buffer object, setting function pointers and resetting internal state.
